fields.description:
h3. Summary

When comparing two different version of pages in Confluences, the 'blue', 'green' and 'red' colouring described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-139379.html] is no longer working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Edit it (make a change and save it)
# Compare the two versions

h3. Expected Results
The change is mark with blue, green or red, depending on the type of the change.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not coloured as it should. It has a strikethrough if it is removed though.

We can see this in the browser's JavaScript console:
{noformat}
batch.js:1976 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Coloring on page version comparison is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JQL in JIRA Issues Macro includes sorting on a field of two words or more (e.g. Request Participates or Due Date), sorting in column view fails with a permissions error.
{noformat}JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.{noformat}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.0-OD-02-009
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.08.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page in Confluence, insert JIRA issues macro, use test JQL: {code:sql}project = TEST ORDER BY "Request participants" ASC{code}
# Create another JIRA issues macro using this test JQL: {code:sql}project = TEST ORDER BY "Key" ASC{code}
# Save page.
# Sort each result separately using column sorting.

h3. Expected Results
Sorting should occur naturally. When you pre-sort in JQL using "Key" it works. You can even remove the sort and it still works.

h3. Actual Results
First JQL that uses Request Participants results in:
 !Screen Shot 2016-02-24 at 16.17.46.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Do not include sort in JQL
fields.summary: Sorting JIRA issues macro with pre-sorted JQL results in permissions error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When unlinking a Confluence space from a JIRA Service Desk via the *Project Settings*, (see [Serving your customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html]) JIRA Service Desk customers still have access to the space.

Before linking the space, the user was not able to view it and *Not Permitted* was displayed on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Project Settings* menu of a JIRA Service Desk project.
# In the *Knowledge Base* tab, select *Link to a Confluence space*.
# In the dropdown list displayed under *Application*, select your Confluence application.
# In the new dropdown list displayed under *Space*, select the space you want to link.
# Click on *Link*.
# If you navigate to the space linked with a JIRA Service Desk customer account, you will be able to see the content of the space.
# Go back to the *Knowledge Base* menu of the previous JIRA Service Desk.
# Select *Don't link to a Confluence space*.

h3. Expected Results
After removing the link to the Confluence space, the user, logged in with a JIRA Service Desk customer account, should have *Not Permitted* displayed on the page when trying to access the Confluence space (where they were previously able to access the space via Service Desk)

h3. Actual Results
The user still has access to the Confluence space.

h3. Notes
Anonymous access is not activated.
Tried clearing cookies and reproduce the issue. User still has access to the Confluence space.

h3.Workaround
Link the space once again to the Service Desk, then select the _Only licensed users who have access to the space_ in the *Access* section. Once it is done, customers won't be able to access the Knowledge Base as they are unlicensed users. Finally, unlink the Knowledge Base from the Service Desk.
fields.summary: Unlinking Confluence space from JIRA Service Desk does not remove permission to access the space

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a page and put a Team Cal macro on it - or go to https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/~jturnquist/2016/02/15/Test+blog+post
* Click "Watch" or "Watching"
* Click "Manage Watchers"

Result:
Sometimes, the list does not load, showing a spinner for all eternity.  This is because it makes a request without the pageId.  Sometimes it works.  Try refreshing and reproducing a few times.

When it doesn't work, you'll see a 404 to:


{code:java}
/wiki/json/listwatchers.action?atl_token=6e3812c74dc7283aba25791246ce87dc9ed7512f&_=1455255630982
{code}

When it works it will make a successful request to 
{code:java}
/wiki/json/listwatchers.action?pageId=524292&atl_token=6e3812c74dc7283aba25791246ce87dc9ed7512f&_=1455255600041
{code}
fields.summary: Team calendar macro breaks space watchers list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating/editing a page in Confluence, some shortcuts may interfere with the shortcuts setup within the web browser being used. i.e., CTRL+1 - 9 will switch between browser tabs in Google Chrome. IF we had the ability to change the default system keyboard shortcuts in Confluence, this would greatly help us avoid conflicts that could possibly arise like this.

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.245.0
Server - Latest

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Type random text into the body text area
# Highlight the text or place your cursor at the end of the word you want to change
# Press CTRL-1 on the keyboard

h3. Expected Results
The highlighted text should change to Heading 1 text style

h3. Actual Results
Chrome switches tabs based on the number key you press in conjunction with CTRL
 
h3. Notes
This does not happen all of the time

h3.Workaround
Rather than using the keyboard shortcut at this point, users can use the text formatting drop down to select the text formatting style they want to use
fields.summary: Default keyboard shortcuts for changing text formatting style i.e., Heading, in Confluence sometimes switch tabs within Google Chrome

h3. Summary
Spaces with non-default title will cause the space to lose its name when imported into any other Cloud instance

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a space, i.e with name and spacekey "New"
# Edit homepage title to anything else i.e change the space homepage title to "Old"
# Create a space backup
# Import to any Cloud instance

h3. Current Behavior
Imported space does not have a name.
- "null" on sidebar 
!Screen Shot 2015-11-25 at 5.07.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- "undefined" in space directory
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-25 at 5.08.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- "$webwork.htmlEncode($space.name)" on space overview 
!Screen Shot 2015-11-25 at 5.07.57 PM.png|thumbnail!

The space is imported with the correct name.

# Edit Details

This can also prevent new pages from being created until the NULL Space Name has been populated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when adding an attachment to a table through drag/drop in Firefox, the cursor location is ignored and the image is added to a completely different table cell. 

h3. Environment
* This is occurring in Firefox only (Firefox 44.0.2)
* Confluence 1000.172.2 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
All steps done in Firefox:
# Create a page in 
# Add a table with at least two rows
# Place your cursor in one of the table cells
# Find a document to attach from your local files
# Click it and drag it to the page and watch it be inserted into the table.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment is added to the table cell where the cursor is located.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is added to a different table cell. In  most cases, it's placed two columns to the right and two rows up. 

h3.Workaround
Either complete this process in Chrome or manually move the attachment to the correct cell once you've uploaded the attachment to the page.
fields.summary: Drag/Drop attachment into table ignores cursor position in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When moving an image that was already present in a global template, the move will not be taken into account when saving the template as well as all other changes made during the edit.
Image in the template was attached from another Confluence page.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Confluence Cloud version 1000.132.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a global template with an image present already in it (image coming from another Confluence page).
# Copy the image and paste it in another section.
# Make other changes to your template.
# Save the template (no error message is displayed on the UI).

h3. Expected Results
Changes are saved and appear when using the template. Or an error message should be displayed if this is per design.

h3. Actual Results
Changes are not saved and the below exception is thrown in Confluence log:
{noformat}
Error unmarshaling editor embedded image
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Content must not be null
	at org.springframework.util.Assert.notNull(Assert.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.CachingAttachmentDao.getLatestAttachment(CachingAttachmentDao.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager.getAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager.getAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DelegatorAttachmentManager.getAttachment(DelegatorAttachmentManager.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.CachingAttachmentManager.getAttachment(CachingAttachmentManager.java:163)
	... 2 filtered
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Attach the image directly to the template and then it works.
fields.summary: Changes are not taken into account when moving an external image in a global template

fields.description:
Some of inline comments are resolved by confluence automatically after another user saves changes.

It happens really often in objects like table or list. It is often not possible to reopen such comment.

It looks like if confluence sometimes interpreted table changes (new rows/columns) as table removal and creation of a new one which resulting in closure of all inline comments even those not related to added/deleted columns/rows.

At least I would like to be informed that my changes will resolve or resolved some of inline comments.

Another thing is that it is impossible to comment strikethrough text (perhaps it is a separate issue).
fields.summary: Inline comments resolve automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding specific user to _Global Permission_ is not possible. The _Indiviual Users_ section is missing when you choose _Edit Permission_. 

h3. Environment
Google Chrome Version 46.0.2490.80 (64-bit)
Mozilla Firefox 41.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Global Permission
# Choose _Edit Permissions_.  The 'Edit Global Permissions' screen appears.

h3. Expected Results
Tried with Confluence Server 5.8.14 and it works
There should be an _Individual Users_ section and a text box to enter username. 

!permission.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
There's no _Individual Users_ section and a text box to enter username

!permission1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to add Individual Users to Global Permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Create multiple task lists using tasklist macro. If you create some inline and then indent others to the right (using tab).
They won't be checked when outside editing mode.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 100.260.0
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert a few tasks to check, using tasklist macro.
# Press tab to indent to the right and insert a few more tasks (attached example print)
# Save the page
# View the page outside editing mode
# Try to check the tasks, only the ones not indented will check others won't. (Sometimes even not indented won't check also).
# If you refresh the page the tasks you clicked and did not check are now checked.



h3. Expected Results
Tasks be checked just as you click on them


h3. Actual Results
Not all tasks are checked when clicked. Has to refresh page to confirm them to be checked.

h3. Notes
This was also tested in a Confluence cloud instance version 100.245.0 and the bug did not occur.

h3.Workaround
Check tasks and refresh page.
fields.summary: Unable to check tasklist checkbox when indented

fields.description:
Existing Confluence Cloud customers are seeing the welcome screen when they shouldn't be - only new users should be. The cause of this is that the add-on determines which users should see the welcome screen by comparing a timestamp of when the plugin was installed against the creation time of the user. The plugin was installed in early May, but only recently had it's dark feature turned on. As a result any user created since May is seeing the Welcome screen.

*Workaround*
Run the following update over the Confluence database:

{noformat}
update bandana
set bandanavalue = '<string>1433218140000</string>'
where bandanakey = 'efi.store.onboarding.plugin-installed-date-in-millis'
{noformat}
fields.summary: Existing Confluence Cloud users seeing Welcome screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The resulting link from a JIRA issue in Confluence is not correct. The resulting link has the format 

{code}https://HOST.atlassian.net/browse/PKEY/browse/PKEY-ISSUE{code} while the correct URL should be {code}https://HOST.atlassian.net/browse/PKEY-ISSUE{code}

The link either results in a 'Project Does Not Exist' error or re-directs to the Active Sprints view in Agile.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Confluence page in an application that is linked with JIRA
# Edit the page
# Enter the project key and issue for an existing JIRA issue anywhere on the page (e.g. TEST-55)
# Save the page
# The page should create a hyperlink to the issue from Confluence
# Click on the link (e.g. TEST-55)
# The following URL is opened https://HOST.atlassian.net/browse/PKEY/browse/PKEY-ISSUE, resulting the error/redirection

h3. Expected Results
The URL should open the JIRA page

h3. Actual Results
The incorrect URL is created with no relevant logs.
 

h3.Workaround
Manually edit the page and make a link with the correct format
fields.summary: JIRA Link In Confluence Not Correct (https://HOST.atlassian.net/browse/KEY/browse/)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On some Confluence Cloud instances, old attachments appears to be missing

h3. Environment
* 1000.230.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check old attachments that were uploaded before January 2016.

h3. Expected Results
Attachments are displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
Attachments lead to _Page not found_ and cannot be downloaded manually.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround currently. Using the *Download All* attachments allow to retrieve the missing attachments.
fields.summary: Some Confluence instances are reporting attachments missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user tries to move a page with editing restrictions, so the user can see but not edit it.

h3. Environment
Cloud Confluence 1000.260.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and pages in Confluence
# Add edit restrictions in one of the pages
# Log in a user restricted to edit the page (that cannot edit due to restriction)
# Go to the 'Reorder page' in 'Content tool' in the space
# Try to move the restricted page up

h3. Expected Results
Confluence must not let the user move the page and must display a warning regarding that
h3. Actual Results
The page title and hierarchy are placed on the top of each other graphically and gets stuck this way until the page is refreshed.
h3.Workaround
Provide the necessary permissions to the related page.
fields.summary: Can't re-order pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding Attachments through Attachments macro is not triggering a notification to page/space watchers.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud: 1000.276.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Attachment macro to a page
# Drag and drop into the Attachment macro to upload an attachment to the page

h3. Expected Results
* A notification should be triggered to space/page watchers.

h3. Actual Results
* A notification is not being triggered to space/page watchers.
 
h3. Notes
* Adding Attachments through *** > *Attachments* is triggering a notification to page/space watchers
fields.summary: Adding Attachment through Attachment macro doesn't trigger notification

fields.description:
The attached thread dumps were captured before the crash.

The first thread dump has multiple LuceneIndex tasks to reindex the attachments. 
And there were 85 attachment download threads in the third dump, however, according to [~nhdang], it should not occur as the size of download pool is configured to be 20, or 20 threads at most.

By going through the codes, I suspect the issue was triggered by generating attachment Lucene Index.
fields.summary: Too many attachment download threads bring down Confluence

# create a backup, using the _backup manager_, of the Confluence instance (inc. attachments)
# import the backup, using the _import site_, into another Confluence instance.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The Site Logo and Favicon are not present on the destination instance

manually add the Site Logo and Favicon  to the destination instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When selecting {{Preview}} next to a .docx or .pdf attachment that is listed in the Attachments Macro in Mozilla Firefox, the application spins and does not display a preview of the file. 

Standard previews of .pdf and .docx also fail.

h3. Environment
This has been tested in the most recent version of Firefox - 45.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in Confluence that uses the Attachments Macro
# Attach a .docx or a .pdf file to the page
# Select the dropdown next to the new attachment 
# Click {{Preview}}

OR

# Open a page in Confluence that has a .pdf or .docx file attatched
# Click on the attachment to preview it

h3. Expected Results
The file should pop up and be previewed within Confluence. 

h3. Actual Results
The preview module opens, but the page just spins. Below is a screenshot of what appears in the console:

!firefox_console.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Open the page in Internet Explorer or Chrome.
fields.summary: Attachment preview spins in Mozilla Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A homepage of a space will not display the Page Tree in the sidebar if it has no child pages.
However, pages on the same hierarchy as the homepage within the space _will_ display the page tree, so it seems that it shouldn't be expected behavior.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.129.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space in Confluence and ensure the homepage has no child pages.
# Create a second page on this space. Move the page to the same hierarchy as the homepage, and not as a child page.
# Visit the homepage and note that the sidebar has Page Tree set to display. Notice that the Space is empty.
# Visit the 2nd page you created on the same hierarchy as the homepage. You will be able to see both this page and the homepage in page tree.

h3. Expected Results
All pages should show full space hierarchy in Page Tree

h3. Actual Results
The homepage will not show pagetree if there are no child pages
All other pages will show pages on the same hierarchy, even if there are no child pages.

h3.Workaround
Move the other pages to be children of the homepage
fields.summary: If a space homepage has no child pages, page tree will not display on sidebar

fields.description:
I've developed an integration between our application (Lucid Meetings) and Confluence that uses OAuth to publish meeting records from Lucid into Confluence.  To do this, I set up an application link for a "Generic Application" in Confluence with *Incoming authentication* only. The OAuth connection works, _provided the user is already logged in_ to Confluence when they attempt to authorize the connection.  If the user isn't logged in, they see the login screen (expected), however, Confluence *prepends /wiki to the Cloud URL* as part of the OAuth process, for example:{{/wikihttps%3A%2F%2Finstance.atlassian.net%2Fwiki%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Foauth%2Fauthorize%3Foauth_token%3DJwgrwp8TYrySjC7UQBkjhO8ULb7usLAw&permission-violation=true}}

If the user is already logged in, tokens are exchanged as desired, the user is prompted to deny or allow access, and our application winds up getting usable OAuth tokens to store for future access. From there on, everything works, even if the user logs out of Confluence. This is something that was working with a local Confluence installation, and although I thought I had it working with Cloud, I may have missed the case where the user needs to log in during the OAuth authentication process.
fields.summary: Confluence > Applink Login redirects to /wiki[destination url] during OAuth

fields.description:

1. Open a page in Edit
2. Drag an image file from windows explorer to the section where you want the image
3. Save page
4. Edit
5. Select image and resize using pixels  eg change 345px to 300px in the textbox
6. Press Enter - nothing happens (until you tab or click out of the text box)

fields.description:
We have a space in our wiki that allows anonymous access. The page status that appears below the page heading is highlighted with a red exclamation mark when the page is viewed anonymously. The users mouse over the exclamation mark, and it says "Failed to get data from the server; please reload the page". Reloading the page doesn't make this go away. They are confused, but there is no apparent harm to the page they are viewing.

I attach two screenshots showing the page status, one when access is anonymous, and one when a logged in user views the page. A reassuring green tick is present in the latter case.
fields.summary: Page Status shows exclamation mark when accessing anonymously

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Copying an mp4 from one page in edit mode and pasting it on another page results in the destination page receiving an 'unknown attachment' error.


h3. Environment
* Tested in Chrome, unsure if it's replicable in other browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two pages
# In page one attach an mp4 and insert it on the page
# While page one is still in edit mode copy the mp4 thumbnail
# Paste it on page two
# Save page one and page two

h3. Expected Results

The mp4 will be present on both pages.

h3. Actual Results

The mp4 won't be present on page two, only an 'unknown attachment' will appear.
 
h3.Workaround

Insert a 'multimedia macro' on the second page and choose the mp4 from the first page to insert.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting mp4 from one page to another results in 'unknown attachment'

fields.description:
I take a screenshot and it copies to my clipboard.
When I then paste it directly into Confluence it doesn't render properly (see screenshot). It used to work. 

As a workaround, I paste it into Keynote instead, then copy / paste into Confluence and it renders fine.
fields.summary: Paste image from clipboard doesn't render

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a space that was created using the recently Deprecated Documentation theme, with Anonymous access enabled, that was converted to Default theme with the depreciation of Documentation theme, will not show any navigation options.  The side bar is completely empty

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud Version 1000.32.0
* Space has been Converted from Documentation theme to Default Theme on update:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/3-january-2016-to-9-january-2016-792302824.html
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2015/07/announcement-some-confluence-features-are-going-away#Announcement:SomeConfluencefeaturesaregoingaway-Documentationtheme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As logged in user Navigate to a Space that has been automatically converted from Documentation theme to Default Theme by the January 3rd update, that also has or has had Anonymous access enabled

h3. Expected Results
Navigation Options are present

h3. Actual Results
Navigation side bar options are missing, No page tree no space tools:
!Screen Shot 2016-04-19 at 11.47.02 AM.png|thumbnail!

A large stack trace is thrown in the JIRA log file with Key Indicator:
{noformat}
2016-04-19 11:54:44.942599500 2016-04-19 11:54:44,939 ERROR [http-bio-1994-exec-3] [plugin.descriptor.web.ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager] getHtml Failed to render web panel: com.atlassian.plugin.web.descriptors.DefaultWebPanelModuleDescriptor$ContextAwareWebPanel@dfd125
2016-04-19 11:54:44.942602500  -- url: /wiki/display/<SPACE_KEY>/TEST+SPACE+Home | traceId: cab26bef5452d5ff | userName: sysadmin | referer: https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action
2016-04-19 11:54:44.942603500 java.lang.RuntimeException: Entities can only be used with a single EntityManager instance
{noformat}

Full Stack trace can be viewed here:
[^stack_trace.txt]

h3. Notes
This only effects Logged in users and Anonymous users can still view the navigation options

h3.Workaround
(!) NOTE the Navigation Path to the Pages will be changed from the <Old Space Key> to the <New Space Key>
- Create a new space, EXE
-- New Space Name: *{{<original space name> 2}}*
-- New Space Key: *{{NEWKEY}}*
--- Testing found that it is critical to change the Space Key as any operation attempted that re-used the original key while recreating the Space triggered the error again, as historical data is retained to preserve the content history, such as view page history.
- Once the new space has been created Go to the erring space
-- https://<INSATNCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/<SPACEKEY>
- Select:
-- The 3 dot icon in the upper right >> MOVE
!Screen Shot 2016-04-19 at 11.09.55 AM.png|thumbnail!
-- Then Select the the new *{{<original space name> 2}}* space created previously
-- Select *MOVE* to complete the move
- Confirm all content moved from the original erring space to the NEW *{{<original space name> 2}}* Space
- Once confirmed Go here:
-- https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/removespace.action?key=<erring Space Key>
-- Delete the erring Space
- Navigate back to the newly Created Space
-- Select Space Tools >> Overview >> Space Details >> Edit Space Details
-- Rename the space to the original name if desired
- If the new Space needs to be public, the Space permissions will need to be reconfigured
-- Navigate to the Permissions Tab
-- Set *Anonymous* Permissions to VIEW
fields.summary: Side Bar Empty in space created in Documentation theme with Anonymous access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence backup hangs when using IE11

h3. Environment

* IE11


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Confluence instance using IE11
# Go to backup manager and click on Create Backup

h3. Expected Results

A .zip file should be generated and displayed at the page

h3. Actual Results

Creating backup keeps spinning as if the .ZIP file wasn't ready yet but, it's possible 
to see in clog that backup proccess was completed. 
Also, when you access the Backup Manager page using another browser it's possible to see that the .zip file 
was created and is available for download.
The below exception is thrown in the browser logs:
\{noformat}
 SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'includes' File: com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.ondemand-backup-manager-confluence:resources.js, Line: 104, Column: 8 
\{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Tested the same proccess with Mozzila and Chrome, with this browser creating backup worked fine.
Tried to refresh Create Backup page in IE11 without success.
h3.Workaround
Create backup using Mozzila ou Chrome
fields.summary: Confluence backup hangs when using IE11

fields.description:

User unable to check a checkbox in confluence page when browsing using Confluence Mobile App in Iphone 5.
h3. Steps to Replicate

 # Install Confluence mobile app in Iphone 5
 # Access the test page in confluence mobile app

h3. Observed Behaviour

User unable to check the checkbox

!upload.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Behaviour

User should be able to check the checkbox.
fields.summary: Unable to tick in checkbox in Confluence mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Files are opening as text on the browser instead of downloading it
h3. Environment
- Cloud

- JIRA v1000.350.1

- Confluence 1000.293.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Looking at the response from the Media API, it's sending the file with a MIME type of just \{\{text/plain}}. If you add \{\{&dl=true}} to the Media API URL that Confluence redirects to it _does_ download instead of loading in the browser, which means it's Confluence that seems to be misbehaving here.


h3. Expected Results
The file should be downloaded
h3. Actual Results
The file is being opened as text in browser
h3.Workaround
right click > Save As
fields.summary: FileStore redirect download does not respect "download" param
Some Confluence instances having an outage

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Content by Label macro is not working when added using Firefox. It's working using other browser like Safari or Chrome
h3. Environment

Mozilla Firefox 49.0.2
 Confluence Cloud: 1000.444.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page using Mozilla Firefox 49.0.2
 # Add a Content by label macro
 # Save the page

h3. Expected Results
 * The Content by Label macro should display correctly

h3. Actual Results
 * The Content by Label macro will display the following error

{noformat}Error rendering macro 'contentbylabel' : Expecting a value for operator '=' after field 'label'{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Use other broser like Chrome or Safari
fields.summary: Content by Label macro is not working when added using Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unusual content added when pasting text from non-proportional sources(terminal, command prompt etc..) to confluence non format macros
h3. Environment

Tested only on Confluence Cloud so far. Version 1000.518.xx
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in confluence
 # Copy any content from a Linux/Mac OS terminal (should work also with windows CMD)
 # Paste the content in a no format macro (like "noformat" or "code block")

h3. Expected Results

This is the exact text piece that was copied from terminal
{code:java} install-studio.sh: 2016-11-21 19:57:32,783 [INFO] PUPPET: 2016-11-21 19:57:32.783542500 Puppet returned 2 {code}
h3. Actual Results

This is exactly what appears when you paste the content
{code:java}

p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Menlo; background-color: #929292}
span.s1 {font-variant-ligatures: no-common-ligatures}



install-studio.sh: 2016-11-21 19:57:32,783 [INFO] PUPPET: 2016-11-21 19:57:32.783542500 Puppet returned 2{code}
h3. Workaround

Manually remove the lines
fields.summary: Unusual content added when pasting text from non-proportional sources(terminal, command prompt etc..) to confluence non format macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Importing a Confluence Space export into Cloud from desktop copy of space is stalling Confluence.  You receive this error message:
!Screen Shot 2016-11-25 at 11.51.09 AM.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.536.1 (wasn't available as a version above)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create XML export of space from Confluence Cloud (preferably not a very small one.) I tested with a 450MB one, so it's not particularly large.
# Import into new Confluence Cloud instance (do not upload to WebDAV first, choose it from your desktop)
# Import stalls and you receive the error.

h3. Expected Results
Import should go through without a hitch.

h3. Actual Results
Error above stating "Page Unavailable"
Checking the resources on the server shows that it didn't time out, and nothing is currently running.
Confluence logs are empty during this time, apache_status and db_connections show nothing is being used.
No waiting threads, database connections are not full.


h3.Workaround
The temporary workaround is to upload document to WebDAV first and then import. However, if WebDAV becomes not an option, we have no workaround.
fields.summary: Importing space stalls Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When restricting groups from specific spaces in Confluence, if the space has been given anonymous permissions, users in the group can still access the space.
Previously, anonymous = users not logged in, but is now allowing all users.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.340.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow [Restrict users to spaces|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restrict-external-users-groups-to-certain-confluence-space-s-417366815.html] article
# On a space where the group *hasn't* been given access, enable Anonymous access.
# Attempt to access that space as the user from the group in step 1 and you'll see you're able to access it.

h3. Expected Results
- Users in that group should not have access to the space, as they are not anonymous nor are they listed as having access on the space.

h3. Actual Results
- Users are able to access the space as if they were an anonymous user.

h3.Workaround
- Remove anonymous access from the space.
fields.summary: Restricted users able to access space with anonymous access enabled

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new space.
 # Create a new page using the Meeting Note template.
 # Assign a task to a user under the "Action Items" heading and save the page.
 # Edit the home page of the page (the one that the auto-generated "Meeting Notes" page is a direct child of) and insert a Children Macro, leave all the options as default but select "Rich content" for the "Excerpt Display" dropdown.
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected results

The page with the Children Macro displays as normal, including any tasks.
h3. Actual results

The tasks don't display, the sidebar is blank, and the buttons at the top of the page (Spaces, People, Questions, Calendars, and the Create button) don't drop down but instead are just links.
h3. Notes

There's a Javascript error in the developer console:
{quote}SyntaxError: JSON Parse error: Unexpected identifier "undefined"
{quote}
It's coming from {{tasks-report.js}} in the Confluence Inline Tasks plugin:
{code:java}    _.each($wrapperOfTasksReportMacro, function(obj) {
        var $this = $(obj),
                $table = $this.find('table.tasks-report'),
                pageSize = $table.data('page-size'),
                totalPages = $table.data('total-pages'),
                pageLimit = $table.data('page-limit'),
                adaptive = $table.data('adaptive'),
                searchString = $this.find("input[name=reportParameters]").val(),
                reportParameters = JSON.parse(searchString);
{code}
Specifically the second-last line.

This issue occurs if there are _any_ tasks to display, regardless of incomplete/complete status.
fields.summary: Children Macro with rich content displayed causes blank sidebar if a child page contains a Task Report that has any tasks

fields.description:

* Notice that the browser navigates to the dashbard

Once the page is refreshed, the like button works as expected.
fields.summary: Liking a comment straight after creating it takes you to dashboard

The new Space Nav feature on Confluence is broken on *Edit* functionality.

Environment

*Edit* button should be shown.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some PDFs are not displaying in macros in Confluence pages when view if their media type is {{application/pdf}}. Those affected PDFs are failing in all Confluence pages, even if you add it to a different clean Confluence instance running the same version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit any Confluence page
# Add the PDF to the page and save it (displaying the PDF as a macro)
# Make sure that the media type is {{application/pdf}}
# Click the PDF macro in the page to view it

h3. Expected Results

The PDF is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown:
{noformat}
Ouch! We can't load the PDF.
{noformat}
 
JS console shows us this:
{code}
Unrecognized Content-Security-Policy directive 'frame-ancestors'.
Failed to load resource: cancelled
{code}

h3. Notes
This can be seen consistently in Safari and in Firefox. Chrome is not affected (not tested in IE/Edge).

h3.Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1
Changing the media type to anything other than {{application/pdf}} resolves this issue:
# Go to the page where the attachment is
# Click '...' >> 'Attachments (7)'
# Find the affected PDF and click 'Properties' next to it
# Edit {{New Content Type}} to something else, we advise adding a single character, so it's easy to undo if needed
# Save it

h4. Workaround 2
Ask Atlassian Support to disable the {{filestore.direct.download}} dark feature. This will require a downtime.
fields.summary: Can't view some PDF some files in Safari and Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's currently not possible to add JIRA related events to a Confluence Team Calendar. Existing events will be displayed as broken.
JIRA Calendar names will be displayed all with the name of the root calendar as on fixed bug [TEAMCAL-3855|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3855]

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.304.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar
# Try to create a JIRA related event. (JIRA Issue Date, JIRA Sprints etc.)

h3. Expected Results
The server field will be auto completed with your JIRA Cloud, and you'll be able to create the event.

h3. Actual Results
The server field locks with a spinning icon 


h3.Workaround
No workaround so far.

h3. Issue Current Status:
We are working on getting the problem fixed.
fields.summary: Unable to create JIRA related event on Team Calendars.

three

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a table within a Center macro and change the text colour of the text within the table, after the page is saved the colour isn't displayed and the table looses its borders, also the table isn't center.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud version 1000.444.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add the Center macro
# Add a table within the Center macro
# Insert text in the table rows and change the colour of the text
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
The colour of the text within the table is the same when formatting the page
h3. Actual Results
The colour of the text within the macro is the default
 
h3. Notes
The table also looses its borders and the text isn't center, which is the main feature of the Center macro
fields.summary: Table within the Center macro loses colour formatting and borders

fields.description:
*Summary*

The links to support.atlassian.com in [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html] points to 
https://support.atlassian.com/projects/JST?_ga=1.133365384.761522391.1460718833

This should point to https://support.atlassian.com/customer/servicedesk-portal?utm_source=landingpage
fields.summary: KB article points to incorrect link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Downloading All attachments from a Blog post returns a Page not found.
 The functionality does work for pages.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Blog post with at least 2 images attached to it
 # Click on the Attachments icon next to the blog title
 # Click on 'Download All'

h3. Expected Results

All attachments are zipped and downloaded. The page doesn't change.
h3. Actual Results

Page not found is displayed
{quote}
*Page Not Found*
 The page you were trying to reach could not be found. This could be because:
 The page does not exist.
 The page exists, but you do not have permission to view it.
{quote}
 
h3. Notes

The browser requests receives a 404 response.
 Confluence doesn't log any errors
h3. Workaround

Download attachments separately by clicking on them one at a time.
fields.summary: Unable to Download ALL attachments from Blog posts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Saved For Later links being sorted by date of page update rather than date save was added
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create 2 page - Page A and Page B.
 # Click saved for later in Page A
 # Click saved for later in Page B
 # After that, edit page A and save the page.
 # Go to saved later main page

h3. Observed Behaviour

Page A will be on top instead of Page B.
h3. Expected Behaviour

Page B will be on top instead of Page A.
fields.summary: Saved For Later links being sorted wrongly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to attach files to a Confluence page through the Attachments page using Drag and Drop.

Depending on the file you submit in the drag and drop box, the browser simply downloads the file or open it in the browser.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Go to Attachments section
# Try to upload a file in the drag and drop box.

h3. Expected Results
The file is loaded in the attachments page

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the loading bar appears, but never completes.
The submitted files are opened in the browser or downloaded again.

h3.Workaround
Manually select the file through the "File browser"
fields.summary: Not possible to attach files in Confluence attachments page using Drag and Drop

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the template has variables and attachments macro, the page created from this template will be blank.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.847.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a template with variables and attachments macro
# Create a page with the template
# Fill the variable
# Click on 'Next'
# The page will be blank

h3. Expected Results
The page should have the template's content

h3. Actual Results
The page is blank
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Templates with variables and attachments macro don't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to filter pages in Recently Viewed Pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open dashboard
# Click upper right drop down (Profile, Task...) in the page and select *Recently Viewed*
# Type some characters in the text area

h3. Expected Results

Incremental search should work correctly.

h3. Actual Results

Incremental search didn't work at all.
Additionally, the following JS errors were shown in a browser developer tool.

{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: _.contains is not a function(…)
onInput			@	batch.js?build-number=6452&hostenabled=true&jquery.external=true&locale=en-US:3341
r			@	commons.7217078….js:28
(anonymous function)	@	batch.js?build-number=6452&hostenabled=true&jquery.external=true&locale=en-US:3331 
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This problem didn't occur on a page {{https://xxx.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action}}.

h3.Workaround
Go to {{https://xxx.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action}} and open *Recently viewed page* modal on the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Perhaps related slightly to CONF-43828 with different behavior.

.kml files are opening automatically as text instead of downloading. Even if you add {{&dl=true}} to the file URL, they will open as text. *.kmz* files DO download by altering the URL.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.340.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach .kml file to a Confluence page
# Navigate to Attachments list, click on the attachment name.
# Instead of downloading, they open as text.

h3. Expected Results
File should download automatically

h3. Actual Results
File opens as text

h3.Workaround
- Right-click and "Save As..."
fields.summary: .KML files are opening as text instead of downloading automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some Confluence Content Formatting Macros cannot be added to a page.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.408.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Try to add Roudrect or Clickable macro

h3. Expected Results
* Should be able to add the macros to a page

h3. Actual Results
* Unable to add the macros to a page
 
h3. Notes
* Add-on modules are enabled 

{noformat}
roundrect (xhtml-roundrect)
roundrect (roundrect)
clickable (xhtml-clickable)
clickable (clickable)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to use some modules of Confluence Content Formatting add-on

fields.description:
h3. Summary
External Gadgets (Macros) that come pre-installed in Confluence Cloud don't work after migrating Confluence to another site.
{noformat}
Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https://URL.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:two-dimensional-stats-gadget/gadgets/two-dimensional-stats-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.
{noformat}

h3. Cause
External Gadgets use the URL saved in it's configuration (in the page content) to contact the source application. These URLs are not updated during Space or Site imports. 

*Note:*
* Adding External Gadgets is not possible on Cloud. There are many macros bundled with Cloud that break when migrating Confluence to a different site as part of a URL migration or simply when moving spaces.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud + JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" macro on a page (or any macro showing under "External content")
# Export Space or Site
# Import on a different Confluence Cloud URL

h3. Expected Results
- If the JIRA site on the new URL contains the same info then the macro displays the information
- If the JIRA site information is different, a descriptive error message is displayed guiding the user to reconfigure the Macro to show results.
e.g. the filter used to select issues is missing. 

h3. Actual Results
* Generic error "Error rendering macro 'gadget' " is shown.
* It is not possible to edit the macro.
* There is no functionality to fix all macros broken.
 !external-gadge-broken.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Page content can be changed in the database to replace the old URL with the new URL to make them point to the new site but other macro configuration may still prevent it from displaying correctly if JIRA information is different.
Please contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com] for assistance.
fields.summary: Pre-installed External Gadgets Macros break when importing on different Cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence backup is not working when Backup Manager is used and include attachments option is checked. Could not generate backup file and when completed shows an error "Woah, Something went wrong! /n Unexpected error during export has occurred"
h3. How to Replicate
 # Go to Backup Manager in confluence
 # Choose Backup and with attachments checked
 # Wait for the backup to complete with Error "Woah! Something went wrong!'

h3. Expected Results

Backup Successful
h3. Actual Results

Backup finish with error
{quote}
"Woah, Something went wrong! /n Unexpected error during export has occurred"
{quote}
 
h3. Workaround

Run backup without attachment Intermittently works (unless you have Gliffy add-on installed). No workaround for full backup with attachment
fields.summary: Unable to generate Confluence Backup using backup manager
Page layout broken after site import

fields.description:
*To reproduce*

Open this page in a new incognito mode and without cache:

[https://templates.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SWPRJ/overview]

*Expected*

You'll see the whole page

*Actual*

Images at the bottom of page are cut off (there are images below the project issues and issue resolution headers).

*!image-2017-01-19-11-46-48-583.png|width=726,height=374!*

 

*To fix*

After page refresh the images appear:

 

!image-2017-01-19-11-48-39-093.png|width=711,height=366!
fields.summary: Space homepage cuts off images at the bottom of page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Share on Confluence* button added to the browser's toolbar is not working

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.842.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Choose *Create from template*, then select *Share a link*
# Drag the Share on Confluence button to your browser toolbar
# Access a webpage
# Click on the *Share on Confluence* to share a webpage
# Click on Share

h3. Expected Results
Clicking the *Share on Confluence* button will let you share the webpage you're currently viewing.

h3. Actual Results
When clicking share, the page reloads within the same page and the link is not shared
fields.summary: Share on Confluence on the Browser's Toolbar is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence is unavailable since last night upgrade.

Navigating to /wiki displays a timeout error page or a maintenance custom error leading to this bug.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to site-url/wiki

h3. Expected Results
Confluence Dashboard is shown

h3. Actual Results
Error page appears and keeps appearing after more than 15 minutes

h3. Notes:
JIRA works as expected
 
h3. Updates:
All sites have been fixed.

h3. Root cause:
A change to the way Confluence accesses Application Links in the database caused it to exhaust its database connections in some circumstances.

h3. Workaround / Solution
Please contact Cloud Support if you haven't already, at support.atlassian.com mentioning this issue to manually run an upgrade with the fix.
fields.summary: Confluence is unavailable

fields.description:
Some JIRA and/or Confluence Cloud instances are currently slow or unavailable, we are investigating the cause as a high priority.

Please monitor http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/zv40h4wdmz0q for updates.
fields.summary: Some JIRA and Confluence Cloud instances are slow or unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Links that are inside the Center or Align macros do not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a *Center* or *Align* macro
# Add a text with a link (internal or external) inside this macro

h3. Expected Results
* User should still be able to click on the link

h3. Actual Results
* Any link inside any of these macros will not work anymore

h3.Workaround
* Remove the Center or Align macro for the texts you need to have linking to another address
fields.summary: Links Inside Center or Align Macros Don't Work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence is not rendering some configurations when using browsing with firefox (spaces, and lines).

 
h3. Expected

We expect the same behavior as when browsing with Google Chrome.

 
h3. Workaround

Use Google Chrome.

Reporter: pturley@pturley.com
fields.summary: Confluence list squeezes out blank lines

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{@mention}} complement doesn't show expected candidates if the username contains following ASCII symbols.
{code:none}
-
'
/
\
{code}
...etc (Not confirmed).

Following characters are verified that they work as expected with {{@mention}} complement.

{code:none}
.
_
{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.690.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1: Create a user which username is {{@aaa-bbb}}.
# Step 2: Try {{@metion}} completion feature on an arbitrary page.

h3. Expected Results
The candidate shows up with {{@aaa-bbb}}.

h3. Actual Results
The candidate shows up until typing {{@aaa-}}, but it's dropped when typing reaches {{@aaa-b}}.

h3. Notes
* This is significant problem if users share the same prefixes in username.
** e.g. {{@atl-alice}}, {{@atl-bob}}, {{@atl-charlie}}

h3.Workaround
* Replace the problem symbols with processable characters such as {{@aaa.bbb}} or {{@aaa_bbb}}.
fields.summary: @mention complement doesn't work well with particular ASCII symbols

fields.description: Creating a Confluence Question will never appear in HipChat if the poster of the question was the user who first set up the HipChat integration. This is because this particular user will proceed past the check of {{maybeAOHipChatUser.isEmpty()}} in {{com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.token.DefaultHipChatTokenRefreshService#refreshablePersonalToken}}. Only after this point do we perform a database operation, which cannot proceed because there is no Session bound to the async event thread (QuestionCreatedEvent). We do not see this behaviour in other places, such as page creation, because the PageCreateEvent is synchronous and thus occurs on the request thread, which does have a Session bound to it.
fields.summary: Confluence HipChat integration fails for user who installed integration for CQ
